comments.commentBody:
Ricardo Ech,

Thanks for your helpful comments. I will try to correct and clarify the ideas:

Assume k > 3, and n is an odd prime, and A, B, C, and D are any four consecutive vertices of P. We know that (AB)^2 and (BC)^2 and (CD)^2 are integers divisible by n. Also, because all vertices have integral coordinates, the squares of all side lengths and diagonal lengths are integers.

By Ptolemy’s theorem, (AB)(CD) + (BC)(AD) = (AC)(BD). We square both sides to get:

[(AB)^2 ][(CD)^2]+ 2(AB)(CD)(BC)(AD) + [(BC)^2][(AD)^2]
= [(AC)^2][(BD)^2]

The term 2(AB)(CD)(BC)(AD) is an integer, since all other terms in the equation are integers.

Note that [(AB)^2 ][(CD)^2] and [(BC)^2][(AD)^2] are both divisible by n. Furthermore, 2(AB)(CD)(BC)(AD) is divisible by n, since it is an integer whose square must be divisible by n^3.

We see that [(AC)^2][(BD)^2] is divisible by n, as it is a sum of integers all divisible by n. So since (AC)^2 and (BD)^2 are integers whose product is divisible by n, polygon P must have a diagonal (either AC or BD) the square of whose length is divisible by n. This completes the induction on k for the case with n being an odd prime.

We next have to generalize the proof to allow n to be a power of an odd prime.

Great theme, well executed. I got done quickly for a Thursday, but most of my guesses ended up being correct.

I loved the clever placement of the theme entries. Thanks.

I'm sorry but this business of endorsing the party's nominee when he is clearly so far beyond the Pale by any standard of decency is just nonsense.  I have NO respect for Republicans who support Trump - none.

The horror of a Donald Trump presidency aside, by refusing to explicitly support his party's nominee, Ted Cruz demonstrated poor political form. He should not have stepped onto that stage unprepared to support Donald Trump. It's a gesture that will define him for the rest of his career as an elected official. He's cooked.

To me, the defining anecdote about Cruz is that while enrolled at Harvard Law School he refused to study with any fellow students who had not completed their undergraduate degrees at Harvard, Yale, or Princeton. How anybody could support Cruz after hearing that story, I don't know.

So Cruz will likely forever be bitter that he lost in 2016 to a graduate of one of the "Minor Ivies" (Donald Trump, UPenn '68). No surprise that he showed up and refused to endorse.

Three days in and still not a single substantive statement on how the Republican Platform will be implemented or even a vague detail - it's all just smoke and mirrors and empty platitudes to some imagined past.  The Juggalos just had their annual party in Ohio too - I can't help but to think there were more significant discussions there than at the RNC.

It appears that the "heavyweights" have thrown in the towel and are figuring on a huge loss in november.  2020 will bring the loons out again and they will probably not win again.  George bush the dull, is finally correct saying he may be the last republican president.  We need three parties and now we are down to one.  I think the rest of the world is watching with shock and disbelief, as well as most of this country.

This was the first major gauntlet thrown down in the Republican presidential fight for 2020.

Cruz from the first has been running for 2020. Surprised that Trump was clearing the field of everyone but him -- and especially of Bush -- Cruz started to take 2016 seriously. Once it was clear he wouldn't get the nomination, he was faced with having to decide if Trump might win. Having decided Trump was likely to lose, Cruz went back to his original plan of preparing for 2020. To do that at this point, he had to maintain his credibility with his supporters, all of whom loathe Trump. Thus it became an easy call not to support Trump and to do it in a very public way with maximum publicity. Not only does Cruz thus embed himself rock solid with his supporters, but he gets points from much of the Republican establishment which, though they do not like him, will appreciate what Cruz did, even if their public cheers are muted.

Again, this was the first major gauntlet thrown down in the Republican presidential fight in 2020.

There are no fools more repulsive than these blowhards who proclaim themselves revealers of "God's will".

The only real question about today's Republicans is who is the most rotten apple in the barrel.

Blind dogmatism? Bad punctuation? Incoherent thinking? It hasn't gotten much attention in this election cycle, but education is the the most important issue of this election. Call me an elitist New Yorker (I am) but education cultivates critical thinking. That's the only long term answer to this kind of comment.
I was really impressed by Ted. He represents the true American. That will defend his values and democratic regardless of his ideology

As a non-supporter of Trump, I am amazed by all of this delusional thinking.  Trump is either tied or leading in the national polls.   If you think that the electorate evidently considering the Donald as President is made up only of fringe white southerners, how did Obama get elected twice?

Well Steve I never did consider Cruz either, except to consider him a self-serving egomaniacal scoundrel. If Cruz is contemplating 2020 he must first contemplate the fact that his support base is even smaller than Trumps', much smaller. When will the GOP wake up and realize that their "base"is a small, shrinking population of fringe religious, firearm toting, racist, white southerners. The independents who helped them get elected in 2000 and 2004 have been driven out because they are not ideologically pure and/or apostate. Jesus Christ certainly wouldn't pass their litmus test. Instead of trying to convince a wider audience of the wisdom of their policies, they each repeat the same scripted anti-Hillary diatribe that they've been droning on with for years. This party is finished on the national stage. If the courts would declare gerrymandering unconstitutional then their hold on the state houses might crumble too. Even so, red states are turning purple and purple states blue faster with every anti-Hispanic speech the republicans make.

The American public should send a "Thanks, but No" card to Donald Trump - "Thanks" we don't have a crazed Ted Cruz to worry about for the next 4 years, and "No" we prefer to elect our leaders who have at least a minimum level of knowledge on the economy, world affairs, a basic grasp of the US Constitution and of our legal system.
Now, I understand why Cruz has the reputation for being the most hated member of the United States Senate.
These people can't even civilly disagree with the person who ended up in second place in the nominating contest.  The ugliness of the GOP and the people at the convention is beyond the pale.

I love it when you all defend Hillary when we have had radical terrorizing left wingers and BLM threaten Trump with his life. The protestors and the left are far more vicious. Hillary did commit a crime despite the fear (from the top down) on indicting her.  Lock her up is fine. She should have been charged and then whatever the law dictates but Comey was probably afraid he would be dead with a suicide note left behind.

Clinton solving the many problems we have? Really? What problems has she ever solved? Name one substantial contribution Mrs. Clinton has made, or one good judgment she can legitimately take credit for in her 25+ years on the public dole. The fact is, that despite her resume, she has none. This is the exactly the kind of get nothing done, mess things up experience we do not need.
I guess he, as dictator, could just imprison whomever he wants, including Hilary Clinton?...Trump world. You all brought him to this place.  It's unbelievable.

This vitriol against Hillary Clinton at the convention is beyond the pale.  From leading the crowds to chant "lock her up," to insinuating that being "an insider" equates with being locked up, to saying she "should be shot for treason," this has gone from political discourse to inciting and slander.  This on top of Trump having already pledged to imprison Mrs. Clinton as he takes office.  Maybe all these Republican leaders and voters have missed that their own witch-hunt committees came up with nothing, not for lack of trying, or that there is no indictment awaiting her.  But hate speech need not be true for its consequences to be real.  These are portraits of irresponsibility.

Think back several months: On stage at one of the Republican debates stood all the candidates, including Cruz, who were asked one by one whether or not they'd support the eventual winner, whoever it may be. Each said yes, he would. That was a shameful moment in itself, considering Trump's inclusion in the race.

Now, more than one has broken his word, including Cruz.

Still brimming with respect?
As much as I dislike the guy, that move took courage. He stood firm to his beliefs in the face of opposition. I hope my state does not reelected him but I respect that move.
Please, don't raise our expectations. You know that's what we want to see.

Blood hatred is the only thing that really focuses The Donald's attention span for more than 30 seconds.

Trump and Cruz are made for a cage match.

Well, Cruz did call a Trump on national television a pathological liar.  Not just for one statement, but according to Cruz everything that he says in fact suspect.  He also condemned him for insulting his beloved father and wife.  So why was Cruz asked to speak at the convention?  Did anyone think he was really going to endorse Trump?  Is pathological liar a qualification for the presidency, Richard Nixon aside?

I agree It is quite nauseating. Religion should be kept out of politics and maintained as a private matter. The evangelicals , catholics and the like should spend their energies on their churches and stay out of politics. They do not have a clue.
I hate when these politicians use religion politically. A lot of Cruz's rhetoric does that. He seems to have forgotten that part of the bible about forgiveness.

In his own way, Ted Cruz did unto Trump what Trump did unto him during the primary.  His "eye for an eye" reaction (to Trump's having used the birther argument against him and claiming Cruz's father was involved in Kennedy's assassination) is the only thing about which I personally could every be in agreement with this arrogant narrow-minded man.  Also, it might be one of the few times that Teflon Trump has ever experienced the consequences of his obnoxious character assassinating behavior.  Yet, that said, I somehow doubt that Trump will be able to connect the dots.
Hope you're right, but I doubt it.
Ted Cruz .your weak attempt at positioning yourself for the future will always be remembered. FOREVER you are done. Loyalty to party, you lost get over it, and you will never get that chance again.
Ted Cruz's awful ME ME ME overblown overlong monologue was painful,found myself calling for the spirit of Chuck Barris to administer The Gong Show hook.Trump Pence 2016 and 2020.
Senator Cruz asked us to vote our conscience and I as a conservative Republican refuse to vote for Trump, a man who mocks the disabled.
Good grief, Trump is many things, but gracious he is not.

David, you need to check with the nearest dictionary the definition of 'gracious', a word that could never been applied to Donald Trump.

p.

Shame on Ted Cruz, you loser!
You only got an invitation to be on that stage because Donald Trump is a gracious person. After he defeated you in the Primary, he praised you...and this is how you return the favor?
I guess I can now put you alongside President Bush (both presidents!); and John Kasich as sore losers!
Are you jealous of Mr. Trump because he has so much money and he defeated you by such a great margin?

It's Senior Prom at the Insane Asylum. The inmates are pairing up, sometimes with imaginary dates, and reminiscing about the old days, how great they were: great TV shows and milk delivered fresh to your door. Some are extremely angry and are yelling at the furniture. Others are milling around quietly, eyes focused on the floor, occasionally muttering something inaudible. Words like "Lucifer" and "treason" are spoken.

On the last day, party hats will be passed out. Everyone will have a grand time. Many delegates will have tears in their eyes, because this will have been the best time of their lives.
That's quite a party you got there, GOP!
He renounced his citizenship.  Sad!
Et tu Cruzus.
Et tu Brutus?
